One of the great disadvantages of hurry is that it takes such a long time. — G.K. Chesterton

University's like this little world, a bubble of time separate from everything before and everything after. — Mhairi McFarlane

The physical reinvention of the world is endless, relentless, fascinating, exhaustive; nothing that seems solid is. Everyone just wasting time because they have so much of it to waste, minutes slipping by on who's with who and did you hear. — Lauren Oliver

agar vaght ra talaf konid zamani fara miresad ke vaght shoma ra talaf mikonad. — William Shakespeare

Can't bring back time. Like holding water in your hand. — James Joyce

Whatever I learned, Whatever I knew, Seems like those faded years of childhood that flew, Away in some dilemma, Always in some confusion, The purpose of this life, Seems like an illusion! — Mehek Bassi

Punctuality is the thief of time. — Oscar Wilde

Have you heard the story of the man who wasted his life taking drugs and playing Sudoku, and when he realized that he could do something meaningful, he worked hard and even got his time back?   There isn’t one because you can’t get your time back. — Neeraj Agnihotri
The time you profligate in procrastinating is the actual wealth you are wasting. — Neeraj Agnihotri

Does our purpose on Earth directly link to the people whom we end up meeting? Are our relationships and experiences actually the required dots that connect and then lead us to our ultimate destinies? — Jennifer Elisabeth

I got tired of feeling like Dracula. I wanted to see some daylight, and not just at six o’clock in the morning. — Kate Moss

If the whole world I once could see On free soil stand, with the people free Then to the moment might I say, Linger awhile. . .so fair thou art. — Goethe

I have no regrets in my life, but this. That we did not have time. — Sarah J. Maas
Things take the time they take. Don't worry. How many roads did St. Augustine follow before he became St. Augustine? — Mary Oliver
